newsitem.title: CHINA: China chain stores to engage in foreign trade.
newsitem.headline: China chain stores to engage in foreign trade.

text.p: China's government has for the first time given 19 domestic chain store enterprises the right to engage in foreign trade, the Xinhua news agency said on Thursday.

Chain store enterprises wanting to handle imports and exports must meet requirements, such as annual sales exceeding 100 million yuan ($12.048 million), having operations separate from administration and being responsible for their own profits and losses, it said.
The 19 enterprises that have obtained foreign trade rights authority include a supermarket, catering business and department store, it said without identifying them further.
They will be allowed to handle their own exports as well as acting as export agents for other enterprises. They can import goods for their own use and for other chain store distribution centres.

They can deal in grains, edible oils, foodstuffs, local products, animal by-products, textiles, silk, garments, arts and crafts, medicines, household electronics products, and other light industry products.
They are prohibited from dealing in products handled as state monopolies, it said.
By end-1996, China had established 700 chain store companies with 10,000 stores. it said.
